intro: Leontodon tomentosus, commonly known as the woolly hawk's-beard, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its hairy, grayish-green foliage and bright yellow composite flowers that bloom in the summer. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and rocky soils, preferring full sun to partial shade. Its flowers are composed of both ray and disk florets, typical of the Asteraceae family. Leontodon tomentosus is often found in disturbed habitats and can thrive in a variety of soil types.
